parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number.  While the absence of a CMF number doesn't automatically exclude it from being electoral propaganda, it suggests it might not be directly linked to an officially registered candidate's campaign.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post mentions "PSD" (Partidul Social Democrat), clearly referring to a specific political party participating in the parliamentary elections. This fulfills the criteria of Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience.  The targeting data shows a broad geographical reach within Botoșani County and surrounding areas. This satisfies the condition of Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's message ("PSD te-a vrut tăcut... A venit vremea schimbării! NOI suntem VOCEA! NOI decidem pe 1 decembrie!") strongly suggests an electoral objective. It aims to influence voters by criticizing the PSD and promoting an alternative ("NOI suntem VOCEA"). The call to action ("NOI decidem pe 1 decembrie!") directly encourages participation in the election, implicitly urging voters to choose the "Vocea Botoșani" alternative. This fulfills the criteria of Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. While it uses some rhetorical devices, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected from journalistic reporting. The clear bias against PSD and the promotion of an alternative voice indicate a clear intention to influence voters' choices.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post is not expressing a personal opinion; it's a political statement aimed at swaying public opinion towards a specific outcome in the election. The language used is not that of personal reflection but rather of political campaigning.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1000778341856558</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by "Vocea - Botosani," directly mentions the PSD, a party participating in the parliamentary elections.  The post's message is clearly designed to influence voters by criticizing the PSD and promoting an alternative. The targeting data shows a wide geographical reach.  While lacking a CMF number, the post's content and targeting strongly suggest it's electoral propaganda aimed at negatively impacting the PSD's electoral prospects. The post's timing (after the official campaign period) is also a crucial factor.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>PSD</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Vocea - Botoșani</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Vocea - Botoșani, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 1000778341856558) cu conținut electoral, care critică Partidul Social Democrat (PSD) și promovează o alternativă, având ca efect electoral influențarea negativă a voturilor pentru PSD.  Postarea, prin mesajul său ("PSD te-a vrut tăcut... A venit vremea schimbării! NOI suntem VOCEA! NOI decidem pe 1 decembrie!") și prin direcționarea geografică extinsă în județul Botoșani, îndeplinește criteriile materialului de propagandă electorală, conform articolului 36 (7) din LEGEA nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, continuând propaganda electorală după încheierea perioadei legale.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
